Uses of Interface
com.experian.aperture.datastudio.sdk.step.StepColumn

  • Packages that use StepColumn 
    Package Description
    com.experian.aperture.datastudio.sdk.step  

    • Uses of StepColumn in com.experian.aperture.datastudio.sdk.step

      Classes in com.experian.aperture.datastudio.sdk.step that implement StepColumn 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Column
      A basic class representing a user-defined column It can be used directly in custom steps, but it is recommended that non-advanced users use the Column object instead.
      Methods in com.experian.aperture.datastudio.sdk.step that return StepColumn 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      StepColumn ColumnManager.addColumn(StepOutput step, String name, String description)
      Create a new custom column and add it to the list of output columns.
      StepColumn ColumnManager.addColumnAt(StepOutput step, String name, String description, int position)
      Create a new custom column and add it to the list of output columns at the position indicated.
      StepColumn ColumnManager.getColumnByName(String name)
      Find and return the StepColumn that matches the given name.
      StepColumn ColumnManager.getColumnFromIndex(int position)
      Returns the StepColumn at the given index
      StepColumn ColumnManager.removeColumn(String columnName)
      Removes a column from the list of output outputColumns
      Methods in com.experian.aperture.datastudio.sdk.step that return types with arguments of type StepColumn 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<StepColumn> ColumnManager.findAllColumnsWithName(String name)
      Finds all output columns that match the given name.
      List<StepColumn> StepOutput.getColumns()
      This overridable method returns a list of columns that are output/provided by the step.
      List<StepColumn> ColumnManager.getColumns()
      Get a list of the outputColumns being output.
